alert.note: Alert for Halifax (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 4:36PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Halifax County through 500 PM EDT... At 435 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Littleton to 8 miles southwest of Roanoke Rapids to 7 miles west of Halifax. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Littleton, Weldon, South Weldon, Airlie, Rosemary, Roanoke Rapids Lake and Lake Gaston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Dont wait until you see the first lightning flash before heading to safety. Move indoors at the first sign of threatening skies or the first sound of thunder. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind. Make sure that lightning is well away from your location before resuming outdoor activity.
